question: Will Donald Trump or Donald Trump Jr. visit Greenland after the launch of this question and before April 1, 2025?
description: Donald Trump Jr. [visited](https://apnews.com/article/greenland-us-trumps-son-visit-56bc01f1d3431c035b22ad6564579938) Greenland on January 7, 2025. This question asks whether he visits again or whether President Trump visits.
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Expert Fadeyev: Trump May Attempt to Acquire Greenland within 100 Days**
Dr. Alexey Fadeyev, an expert on Arctic issues, believes that US President Donald Trump may attempt to start the process of purchasing Greenland within the first 100 days of his second term. According to Fadeyev, this would be a long-term process, rather than a one-time payment. The US has been interested in acquiring Greenland since the 19th century, due to its rich natural resources, including oil, gas, and rare earth metals. Trump previously made a proposal to Denmark in 2019, but was rejected. Fadeyev stated, 'In the US, there is a competition between presidents - it's very important to show results in the first 100 days of their presidency, so these days for Trump will be very busy and active, and I'm sure that Greenland, which is in his focus, is an example of his vision and strategic thinking. He thinks exclusively through the prism of business, and everything he does has the potential for commercialization. I think that the decision to start the process of acquiring Greenland will be made in the next 100 days of Trump's presidency.' Fadeyev also noted that the purchase would not be a one-time payment, but rather a long-term contract or concession, where Denmark would receive certain benefits over a long period of time. He believes that the US would use an economic multi-vector mechanism to acquire Greenland, as it would be difficult to evaluate the cost of such a purchase. Fadeyev also mentioned that the US may use economic or military pressure on Denmark and Europe if they refuse to sell Greenland, but considers this possibility to be low. He stated, 'I think that for European countries it would be more expensive not to agree to the sale of Greenland. Trump will go to the end and achieve his goal.'
Original language: ru
Publish date: February 13, 2025 12:21 AM
Source:[ТАСС](https://tass.ru/politika/23124737)

**Trump's Greenland Plan Gets Even More Absurd**
Donald Trump's plan to annex Greenland and bring it under US control has caused a stir. Initially, it was thought to be a joke, but it soon became clear that Trump was serious. According to reports, Trump had been considering the idea before taking office and was willing to use military and economic pressure to gain control of the island. Now, a Trump supporter, Buddy Carter, has proposed a bill that would allow Trump to negotiate the purchase of Greenland and rename it 'Red, White and Blueland'. Carter seems to be taking the plan seriously, saying, 'President Trump has correctly identified the purchase of today's Greenland as a national security priority, and we will welcome its people with pride into the freest nation on earth when our chief negotiator signs this monumental agreement.' Trump's plan seems to be getting more and more absurd.
Original language: de
Publish date: February 12, 2025 08:26 AM
Source:[news.de](https://www.news.de/politik/858365582/donald-trump-plan-fuer-annexion-von-groenland-immer-irrer-maga-politiker-will-arktisinsel-rot-weiss-und-blau-land-nennen/1/)

**Trump's Greenland Annexation Plan Gains Support from US Congress**
US President Donald Trump is seeking to annex Greenland and has received support from the US Congress. Republican Representative Buddy Carter has introduced a bill that would give Trump the authority to negotiate the purchase of the Danish territory and rename it 'Red, White and Blueland'. According to Carter, 'President Trump has correctly identified the acquisition of today's Greenland as a national security priority, and we will welcome its people with pride into the freest nation on earth when our chief negotiator signs this monumental agreement.' Trump has been considering purchasing Greenland since his first term and has sent his son Donald Trump Jr. to visit the island. However, the Danish and Greenlandic governments have stated that the island is not for sale, and a recent poll showed that 85% of the island's residents are against annexation, with only 6% in favor.
Original language: de
Publish date: February 12, 2025 03:21 AM
Source:[n-tv.de](https://www.n-tv.de/politik/Republikaner-Groenland-soll-Red-White-and-Blueland-heissen-article25555707.html)

**US Congress Supports Trump's Plan to Annex Greenland**
US President Donald Trump has been given support by the US Congress for his plan to annex Greenland. Republican Representative Buddy Carter has introduced a bill that would give Trump the authority to negotiate the purchase of the Danish territory and rename it 'Red, White and Blueland'. According to Carter, 'President Trump has correctly identified the acquisition of today's Greenland as a national security priority, and we will welcome its people with pride into the freest nation on earth when our chief negotiator signs this monumental agreement.' Trump has been considering purchasing Greenland since his first term, and has sent his son Donald Trump Jr. to visit the island. However, the Danish and Greenlandic governments have stated that the island is not for sale, and a recent poll showed that 85% of Greenland's residents are against annexation, with only 6% in favor.
Original language: de
Publish date: February 12, 2025 02:26 AM
Source:[N-tv](https://www.n-tv.de/politik/Republikaner-Groenland-soll-Red-White-and-Blueland-heissen-article25555707.html)

**Trump's Plan to Rename Greenland to 'Red, White and Blueland' Sparks Controversy**
US Representative Buddy Carter (R-GA) unveiled a new bill, the Red, White and Blueland-Act 2025, which would allow President Donald Trump to negotiate the purchase or acquisition of Greenland. The bill would require the Department of the Interior to update federal paperwork to reflect the new name, which must be done within six months. Carter stated, 'President Trump has correctly identified the acquisition of what is now Greenland as a national security priority and we will proudly welcome the population to join the freest nation that has ever existed when our chief negotiator closes this monumental deal.' However, the bill is not yet in effect and must be referred to a committee for review before it can be sent to a vote. Trump has been discussing the idea of acquiring Greenland since December and even sent his eldest son, Donald Trump Jr., to the island as a publicity stunt last month. The bill has been met with opposition, with a recent poll showing that only 6% of Greenlanders want their country to join the US. The minister of Foreign Affairs, Marco Rubio, has defended the president's goal of acquiring Greenland, citing the US's military support for the island and a 1951 treaty to defend it in the event of an attack. 'If we have to do that, then we can just as well have more control over what happens there,' Rubio said in an interview with The Megyn Kelly Show. 'This is not a joke, this is not about acquiring land to acquire land. This is in our national interest and it needs to be resolved.'
Original language: nl
Publish date: February 12, 2025 02:06 AM
Source:[Het Nieuwsblad](https://www.nieuwsblad.be/cnt/dmf20250211_98049980)

**Trump's Plan to Rename Greenland to 'Red, White and Blueland' Sparks Controversy**
US Representative Buddy Carter unveiled a new bill on Monday that would give President Donald Trump the authority to negotiate the purchase or acquisition of Greenland. The Red, White and Blueland-Act 2025 would task the Department of the Interior's team with updating federal paperwork to reflect the new name, which must be done within six months. 'President Trump has correctly identified the acquisition of what is now Greenland as a national security priority and we will proudly welcome the population to join the freest nation that has ever existed when our top negotiator closes this monumental deal,' said Carter. The legislation is not yet in effect and must be referred to a committee for review before it can be voted on. Since December, Trump has been discussing the idea of taking over Greenland. He even sent his eldest son, Donald Trump Jr., to the island last month as a publicity stunt. Trump has stated that acquiring Greenland is crucial for US national security due to its vast natural resources and access to the North Sea, which will become increasingly valuable as it melts. US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has also defended the president's goal of acquiring Greenland by citing the US military's support for the island and a 1951 treaty to defend it in case of an attack. 'If we have to do that, we might as well have more control over what happens there,' Rubio said in an interview with The Megyn Kelly Show. 'This is not a joke, this is not about acquiring land to acquire land. This is in our national interest and it needs to be resolved.'
Original language: nl
Publish date: February 12, 2025 02:00 AM
Source:[nieuwsblad.be](https://www.nieuwsblad.be/cnt/dmf20250211_98049980)

**Inside Trump-Led Bill To Rename Greenland 'Red, White And Blueland'**
A Republican Congressman has introduced a bill in the House of Representatives to aid President Donald Trump's efforts to purchase Greenland from the Kingdom of Denmark and rename it to 'Red, White and Blueland.' Trump has repeatedly stated his desire to purchase Greenland, citing national security concerns. His son, Donald Jr., even visited the Danish territory in January to meet with natives and discuss a possible acquisition.

**GA Congressman Proposes Bill To Buy Greenland, Name It 'Red, White And Blueland'**
U.S. Rep. Buddy Carter has introduced a bill, the 'Red, White and Blueland Act of 2025', which would allow President Donald Trump to acquire and rename Greenland to 'Red, White and Blueland'. Carter stated, 'America is back and will soon be bigger than ever with the addition of Red, White and Blueland.' The bill aims to make Greenland a national security priority and welcome its people to join the United States. According to Carter, President Trump has correctly identified the purchase of Greenland as a national security priority. The bill's goal is to ink a 'monumental deal' with Greenland, with Carter expressing pride in the potential addition of the territory to the U.S.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 11, 2025 10:12 PM
Source:[Patch](https://patch.com/georgia/atlanta/red-white-blueland-ga-bill-would-allow-trump-buy-greenland)

**Calls for Trump to RENAME Greenland 'Red-White-And-Blueland'**
Republican congressman Buddy Carter has proposed renaming Greenland 'Red, White and Blueland' and entering negotiations to seize the ice island. Carter, 67, unveiled the Red, White, and Blueland Act of 2025, which would require the secretary of the interior to update federal paperwork with the new name for Greenland within six months. Carter said, 'America is back and will soon be bigger than ever with the addition of Red, White, and Blueland.' The proposal comes as President Trump has long set his sights on the frozen island, and even sent his son there for an unofficial visit before his second inauguration. Denmark, which owns Greenland, has strongly insisted the island is not for sale, but Trump has refused to rule out using military force to seize the island.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 11, 2025 09:02 PM
Source:[The US Sun](https://www.the-sun.com/news/13516617/trump-rename-greenland-red-white-blueland-national-security-priority/)

**Commentary: Trump means business with his Greenland proposal**
US President Donald Trump's proposal to acquire Greenland has been met with skepticism, but experts believe it's a serious move. Greenland's strategic location and natural resources, including rare earth metals, precious stones, and oil, make it a valuable asset. China and Russia are also vying for control of the island, and Trump's plan could be a way to counter their influence. Greenland's prime minister, Mute Egede, has expressed opposition to the idea, but Trump has hinted at military intervention if a deal can't be reached. The stakes are high, with the US, Russia, and China engaging in a geostrategic rivalry in the Arctic. As Vladimir Barbin, Russia's ambassador to Denmark, said, 'attempts to ensure U.S. national security at the expense of other nations may result in further deterioration of the situation in the Arctic, which Russia will take into account in its military planning.' Trump's interest in Greenland is also driven by its potential for space power projection, with the US needing infrastructure in the Arctic Circle to control its satellites. The US has a military presence in Greenland, and Trump is considering options such as statehood or a 'Freely Associated State' status, which would grant Greenland financial assistance in exchange for a US military presence.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 11, 2025 07:10 AM
Source:[grandforksherald.com](https://www.grandforksherald.com/opinion/columns/commentary-trump-means-business-with-his-greenland-proposal)

**Trump's Greenland Ambitions Spark Concerns**
Donald Trump's son, Donald Trump Jr., visited Greenland on January 7, 2025, and met with local residents. Trump Jr. stated that the visit was a private trip and that he wanted to see the beauty of the Arctic Circle and talk to the people. However, the visit has sparked concerns and anxiety among the local residents, as Trump Jr.'s father, Donald Trump, has been making statements about acquiring Greenland, including the possibility of using military force. Trump Jr. said that his father would 'treat' the people of Greenland well if they were to become part of the United States. The visit has also raised questions about the future of Greenland's autonomy and its relationship with Denmark. Greenland has been seeking greater autonomy and has been granted the right to hold an independence referendum. The island's residents are concerned about the potential consequences of becoming a US territory, including the loss of their social welfare system and the potential for exploitation of their natural resources.

**Greenland's Potential Shift: Trump Junior's Visit Sparks Speculation**
Donald Trump Junior visited Nuuk, the capital of Greenland, on January 7, 2025. He shared a meal with locals at a luxurious restaurant, where they enthusiastically expressed their desire for Greenland to be part of the United States. Trump Junior even called his father, who warmly greeted the assembly, saying, 'Your territory is so strategic, so special. We want security for our country and for the world.' Trump Junior left after a few hours, departing on a private jet. The visit was reportedly orchestrated by Trump's communication teams the day before, who recruited supporters to attend the official visit.

**Trump's Greenland Gambit: A Visit Sparks Controversy**
The controversy surrounding Greenland has reignited, with Donald Trump Jr.'s visit to the island sparking debate over who should control the territory. Donald Trump Sr. has expressed interest in incorporating Greenland into the United States. Trump Jr. visited Greenland on January 7, 2025, on a private jet, which has raised concerns about the environmental impact of the visit, given the already fragile Arctic region. According to reports, Trump Jr.'s visit was brief, lasting only a few hours. The visit has left the Greenlandic people and the international community in a state of uncertainty, as Trump Sr.'s intentions for the island remain unclear.
Original language: pt
Publish date: January 07, 2025 07:32 PM
Source:[UOL  notícias](https://noticias.uol.com.br/ultimas-noticias/deutschewelle/2025/01/07/a-polemica-em-torno-da-groenlandia---e-o-que-trump-tem-a-ver-com-isso.htm)

**Donald Trump Jr. Visits Greenland, Calling it 'Incredible'**
Donald Trump Jr., son of the elected President of the United States, visited Greenland on January 7, 2025. The visit comes after his father's comments on the potential integration of the territory into the US, a proposal that has been widely criticized. Trump Jr. described Greenland as 'beautiful' and 'a group of incredible people' on his podcast, Triggered. The visit is considered private, with no scheduled meetings with government representatives. The Greenlandic Ministry of Foreign Affairs stated that the country is 'open' to visitors and that those who wish to visit are welcome. Trump Jr. was accompanied by Charlie Kirk, a conservative activist and co-founder of Turning Point USA. Since his election win in November, Donald Trump has expressed support for Greenland's integration into the US, a proposal he also made in 2019 during his first term in the White House. 'The United States of America understands that the possession and control of Greenland are an absolute necessity,' Trump wrote on Truth Social in December. He reiterated this stance on Monday night, stating that 'several representatives' would also travel to Greenland 'to visit some of the most magnificent zones and landscapes.' 'Greenland is an incredible place, and the people will greatly benefit if, and when, it becomes part of our Nation. We will protect and cherish it from a very cruel outside world. MAKE GREENLAND GREAT AGAIN!' he wrote on Truth Social.
Original language: pt
Publish date: January 07, 2025 07:11 PM
Source:[observador.pt](https://observador.pt/2025/01/07/trump-jr-visita-a-gronelandia-que-o-pai-definiu-como-necessidade-absoluta-queremos-conhecer-as-pessoas/)

**Donald Trump Jr. Visits Greenland Amidst Controversy Over Island's Status**
Donald Trump Jr. visited Greenland on January 7, 2025, amidst controversy over the island's status between the US and Denmark. Trump Jr. stated that he was on a 'personal one-day trip' to meet with people and did not plan to meet with local officials. However, his visit comes on the heels of his father's previous statements expressing a desire to 'buy' Greenland, which Denmark has repeatedly denied. Trump Jr. posted on Twitter, 'Greenland is beautiful!!!', and shared photos of his visit. The visit has sparked renewed debate over the island's status and whether it can be purchased.
Original language: uk
Publish date: January 07, 2025 04:00 PM
Source:[pravda.com.ua](https://www.pravda.com.ua/news/2025/01/7/7492432/)

**Donald Trump Jr. Visits Greenland Amid Father's Claims of 'Absolute Necessity'**
Donald Trump Jr. arrived in Greenland on January 7, 2025, on a private plane owned by his father, Donald Trump. According to AFP, a video from the Nuuk airport shows a Boeing 757 with the Trump logo landing on the runway. Trump Jr. stated on the social media platform Rumble that he is visiting Nuuk as a tourist and will be speaking with locals, but not to 'buy Greenland.' However, sources from Reuters and AP claim that the real purpose of his visit is to film content for his podcast and that he will not be meeting with local officials or politicians. The Danish Ministry of Foreign Affairs has confirmed that they are aware of the visit, but have no official comment. This visit comes after Donald Trump's previous statement on Truth Social, where he promised to make Greenland 'great again' and claimed that it is 'absolutely necessary' for the US to control the island for national security and freedom. Trump has made similar statements before, including a 2019 proposal to buy the island from Denmark, which was rejected. The majority of Greenland's population supports independence, but there are disagreements on the timeline and potential impact on living standards.
Original language: uk
Publish date: January 07, 2025 03:21 PM
Source:[Deutsche Welle](https://www.dw.com/uk/trampmolodsij-pribuv-do-grenlandii-na-tli-obicanok-jogo-batka-priednati-ii-do-ssa/a-71239082)

**Donald Trump Jr.'s Visit to Greenland: A Step Towards a Broader Imperialist Project**
Donald Trump Jr. has arrived in Greenland, sparking speculation about the reasons for his visit. The trip comes as President-elect Trump has repeatedly expressed his intention to buy or annex the country during his second term. According to sources, the purpose of Don Jr.'s visit is to film content for his podcast, 'Triggered with Don Jr.'. The podcast, launched in January 2023, is the most listened to on Rumble, a platform popular with conservative Americans. Trump has welcomed the trip on Truth Social, while reiterating his ambition to annex Canada. The visit has been met with interest from the Danish press, with several media outlets covering the event live. The trip is part of a broader imperialist project, with Trump and his allies aiming to expand US territory. The project includes the annexation of Canada and the construction of a canal in Panama. A map showing a US expansion to the Mediterranean and the South China Sea has been viewed over 5 million times on X, a social media platform. The map is part of a trend known as 'Ameriwank', where users reimagine the US map with alternative histories. Trump's proposal to annex Greenland is seen as a serious idea by some, with one advisor stating that expansion is a time-honored American tradition. The majority of Canadians oppose the idea of becoming the 51st US state, with only 13% in favor. Trump has stated that the ownership and control of Greenland are necessary for US security and freedom. The visit has been met with skepticism, with some questioning the true motives behind Trump's plans.
Original language: fr
Publish date: January 07, 2025 02:44 PM
Source:[legrandcontinent.eu](https://legrandcontinent.eu/fr/2025/01/07/donald-trump-jr-au-groenland-le-projet-imperial-trumpiste-dune-grande-amerique-en-deux-cartes-exclusives/)

**Donald Trump Jr Visits Greenland Amid Speculation Over Possible US Purchase**
Donald Trump Jr, the eldest son of the incoming US President, will visit Greenland on January 7th for private meetings. Trump Jr has stated that the trip is to visit some of the island's most impressive areas and that the people of Greenland will benefit if it becomes part of the US. However, the Greenlandic authorities have denied any planned meetings with government officials. The visit comes after Donald Trump expressed interest in buying Greenland, which he claims is 'a necessity for US national security.' The Greenlandic president, Múte B. Egede, has stated that Greenland 'is not for sale' and that the country values its relationships with neighboring countries like the US. 'My son, Don Jr, and several representatives will travel there to visit some of the most impressive areas and views. Greenland is an incredible place and the people will benefit if it becomes part of our nation,' wrote Donald Trump on Truth Social. 'No, I will not buy Greenland,' said Trump Jr in his own podcast, adding that the trip is private and he wants to speak with the people of that 'incredible place.'

Publish date: January 07, 2025 02:30 PM
Source:[El Financiero](https://www.elfinanciero.com.mx/mundo/2025/01/07/trump-confirma-que-su-hijo-visita-groenlandia-para-comprarla-se-beneficiara-si-es-parte-de-eu/)

**Donald Trump Jr. travels to Greenland amid father's interest in U.S. purchase**
Donald Trump Jr. arrived in Greenland on January 7, 2025, for a private visit, two weeks after his father, President-elect Donald Trump, expressed interest in purchasing the Arctic island for U.S. national security. Trump Jr. stated that he was traveling as a tourist and would not be meeting with government officials, describing the trip as a 'long, day trip' in a personal capacity. He aimed to engage with the local people during his visit.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 07, 2025 01:21 PM
Source:[UPI](https://www.upi.com/Top_News/World-News/2025/01/07/Trump-JR-Greenland-trip/2631736250009/)

**Donald Trump Jr. to Visit Greenland Amid Father's Renewed Interest**
Donald Trump Jr., son of the US president-elect, plans to visit Greenland on Tuesday, following his father's renewed interest in acquiring the vast Arctic island. According to Mitenqak Klaest, the permanent secretary for foreign affairs in Greenland, the visit is private and no meetings with government representatives are scheduled. 'We have not been informed about the nature of his program, so this is a private visit,' Klaest told Reuters. The visit is expected to last around 4-5 hours, with Trump Jr.'s plane landing at around 13:00 GMT. A source familiar with the details of the trip told Reuters that Trump Jr. plans to visit for a day to film content for a podcast, and will not meet with any government officials or politicians. Greenland is a self-governing territory of Denmark with a population of just 57,000 people, rich in minerals, oil, and natural gas, but with a slow-developing economy that relies heavily on fishing and annual subsidies from Denmark. President-elect Trump has praised Greenland on his social media platform, Truth Social, saying 'I will make Greenland great again.' Trump previously expressed interest in buying Greenland during his 2017-2021 presidency, but the island's authorities and Denmark rejected the idea publicly before any discussions took place.
Original language: ar
Publish date: January 07, 2025 12:52 PM
Source:[independentarabia.com](https://www.independentarabia.com/node/615258/%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A3%D8%AE%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%B1/%D9%86%D8%AC%D9%84-%D8%AA%D8%B1%D9%85%D8%A8-%D9%8A%D8%B9%D8%AA%D8%B2%D9%85-%D8%B2%D9%8A%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%A9-%D8%BA%D8%B1%D9%8A%D9%86%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%AF-%D8%A8%D8%B9%D8%AF-%D9%88%D8%B9%D9%88%D8%AF-%D9%88%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AF%D9%87-%D8%A8%D8%AD%D9%8A%D8%A7%D8%B2%D8%AA%D9%87%D8%A7)

**Donald Trump Jr. to Visit Greenland Amid Father's Renewed Interest**
Donald Trump Jr., son of the incoming US President, plans to visit Greenland on Tuesday, following his father's renewed interest in controlling the vast Arctic island. According to Mads Marcussen, the permanent representative of Greenland's Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the visit is private and no meetings with government representatives are planned. 'We have not been informed about the nature of his program, so this is a private visit,' Marcussen said, adding that Trump Jr.'s plane is expected to land around 13:00 GMT and will stay for 4-5 hours. A source familiar with the details of the trip said that Trump Jr. plans to spend one day in Greenland to film content for a video podcast and will not meet with any government officials or politicians. Greenland is an autonomous territory within Denmark with a population of 57,000 people and rich mineral, oil, and gas reserves, but its slow development has made its economy reliant on fishing and annual subsidies from Denmark. The incoming US President, Trump, has praised Greenland on his social media platform 'Truth Social' and promised to 'make Greenland great again!' Trump had previously expressed interest in buying Greenland during his 2017-2021 presidency, but the island's authorities and Denmark rejected the idea publicly before any negotiations took place.

**Trump Jr. Plans Trip to Greenland, Father Sees Opportunity for Annexation**
Donald Trump Jr. has planned a trip to Greenland for January 7, according to Fox News Digital, citing sources. Trump Jr. stated that he will travel to Greenland 'to have a little fun.' The trip is expected to last one day, during which Trump Jr. will film a 'fun video' for his podcast. However, Trump Sr. has clarified that the trip's purpose is not solely for entertainment. Trump wrote on Truth Social: 'I heard the people of Greenland are 'MAGA.' My son Don Jr. and various representatives will visit some of the most beautiful places and attractions. Greenland is an incredible place, and people will greatly benefit if and when it becomes part of our country... We will make Greenland great again!' Trump previously mentioned his desire to annex Greenland when appointing his ambassador to Denmark, stating: 'In the interest of national security and freedom worldwide, the United States of America considers ownership and control of Greenland to be an absolute necessity.'

**Donald Trump Jr. to Visit Greenland on Private Trip**
Donald Trump Jr., the eldest son of US President-elect Donald Trump, is expected to visit Greenland on a private trip. According to Fox News, the trip is scheduled to start on Tuesday, January 7. Trump Jr. will reportedly meet with local residents and visit cultural sites in the capital city of Nuuk. 'As someone who has traveled to several interesting places around the world as a tourist, I'm excited to have some fun in Greenland this week,' Trump Jr. said. However, a source close to the Trump family revealed that the trip is actually a one-day excursion to film a humorous video for a podcast. This comes after Donald Trump Sr. tweeted that the US considers control over Greenland 'absolutely necessary for national security and freedom around the world.'

**Donald Trump Jr. to Visit Greenland Amid Father's Claim of Strategic Importance**
Donald Trump Jr., the 47-year-old son of the designated US President Donald Trump, is reportedly planning to visit Greenland. According to Fox News and The Hill, he will arrive in the capital Nuuk on Tuesday. Trump Jr. stated, 'As someone who has traveled to some fascinating places around the world as a nature lover, I'm looking forward to making a stop in Greenland this week to have some fun.' He plans to meet locals, visit cultural sites, and record material for videos and podcasts. Trump Jr. has not been publicly assigned to any official position in his father's government, but he was actively involved in the presidential campaign. Greenland is strategically important due to its location in the Arctic, proximity to Russia, potential mineral resources, and a significant US military base. Denmark has previously rejected Trump's proposal to buy the island, which is approximately six times the size of Germany and has a population of around 56,000.
Original language: de
Publish date: January 07, 2025 12:18 AM
Source:[ln-online.de](https://www.ln-online.de/politik/trump-sohn-donald-jr-will-nach-groenland-reisen-CTSXDDFVEFIQ3NKXMKKBUAKBAE.html)
